name: Color Lines Extended
description:
This is a small simple puzzle game. Your need to arrange balls of the same color into straight (vertical, horizontal or diagonal) lines of five or more, like this:

 Arranged line will disappear. Each turn, three more random balls are added. Game continues as long as you can make any move.

Special Objects

  Multicolored ball - counts as one ball of any color.

  Cube - counts as three balls of a given color. Cannot be moved.

  Obelisk - counts as two balls of any color. Cannot be moved.

  Trash - does not count as anything, cannot be moved or removed in any way. Ensures that the game ends eventually =)

  Trap - invisible. When a ball steps on a trap, both disappear.

  King Ball - counts as one ball of any color. Gives 5 points every turn. Multiply the points for completed line by 10. Only one per game.
Options

Number of colors: from 3 to 9

Number of starting balls: from 3 to 15

Balls per turn: from 1 to 9

Length of the line to complete: from 3 to 9

History

This is a variation of 1993 game called "Color Lines".

There are a many clones of Color Lines available online, this version allows for options, more colors and extra objects.

I made this game around 2007 using Visual Pascal or something like this. There is a small problem with encoding, but I dont have neither the source code, nor tools for programming in Pascal anymore, so I cannot fix them.
